data.title: Al Jarreau
data.meta_description: Al Jarreau artist page: interviews, features and/or performances archived at NPR Music
data.text:
'Jazz Night In America' Remembers Artists We Lost In 2017

WBGO and Jazz at Lincoln Center

Friends of our program honor a handful of departed artists, celebrating their lives in an episode filled with insight, humor and plenty of music.

'Jazz Night In America' Remembers Artists We Lost In 2017

56:50

Al Jarreau, Versatile Vocalist Who 'Played His Voice,' Dies At 76

Since the legendary singer began his career in the 1960s, he won Grammys in the jazz, pop and R&B categories. Just one clue that Jarreau, who died Sunday, was impossible to categorize.

Al Jarreau, Versatile Vocalist Who 'Played His Voice,' Dies At 76

5:32

Voices: Al Jarreau On Jon Hendricks

The paragon of vocal cool courted his wife of nearly 35 years with Hendricks' vocalese lyrics. And to this day, Jarreau still considers the elder statesman a major influence on his music.

Summer Tunes for Black Music Month, Part 3

News and Notes with Ed Gordon concludes its three-part roundtable series on the art and business of African-American music. This week, we talk with three professionals who've been on the business and creative sides of the music industry â€” and who know all too well the business of music.

Summer Tunes for Black Music Month, Part 3
